original: de la drug pa ye shes kyi phung po dang / ye shes kyi khams dang / ye shes kyi dbang po dang / ye shes kyi yul dang / de bzhin du ye shes kyi las kyi dbang po dang / de'i bya ba'o //

analyzed: de rnams la khyab par byed pa ni sum cu rtsa bdun pa ste /

analyzed: de'i yan lag la ga ni rnam gsum mam rnam pa mang por 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: nang gi lus zhes pa la lus zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //

analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: de ni lus kyis nye bar mtshon par bya'o //

original: 'dir nang gi lus gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir nang gi lus gsungs pa /

translated: ‚ÄúOne should enjoy‚Äù means in order to proliferate.

original: des na shes bzhin zhes pa dang gi sgra ni sdud pa'i don to //

analyzed: lha'i dbang pos sems can rnams kyi lus kyi las shes pa'o //

original: des na dran pa dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi rnam par gsal te zhes pa ni sngon du mngon shes thob pas rang las byung ba'i 'jig rten gyi gdul bya de rnams des dran pa de'i bdag nyid kyis dran zhing rtogs pa'i don to //

translated: Therefore, ‚Äúthe world that is endowed with memory is illuminated‚Äù means that the world of disciples who have arisen from himself is remembered by that memory, which is the nature of the TathƒÅgata.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi bdag nyid las byung ba'i sems can sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa de rnams kyi ci zhig rnam par gsal zhes brjod de sa bon gyi khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi bdag nyid las byung ba'i sems can sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa de rnams kyi ci zhig rnam par gsal zhes brjod de sa bon gyi khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Since sentient beings who have previously accumulated roots of virtue arise from his own nature, what is it that is illuminated? Is it not the case that a special result arises from a special seed?

original: ji ltar 'bras kyi myu gu las 'bras kyi 'bras bu 'byung gi khre ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras kyi myu gu las 'bras kyi 'bras bu 'byung gi khre ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as a rice sprout arises from a rice seed, not from a barley seed,üîΩand a barley sprout arises from a barley seed, not from a rice seed,üîΩin the same way, a special result arises from a special seed.

original: 'di ltar shin tu rnam par dag pa'i sems kyi sa bon dang / las khyad par can las 'bras bu khyad par can skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'ga' zhig som nyi za bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar shin tu rnam par dag pa'i sems kyi sa bon dang / las khyad par can las 'bras bu khyad par can skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'ga' zhig som nyi za bar 'gyur na /
translated: If someone doubts that a special result arises from a special seed,

original: de la brjod pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la brjod pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: To this we reply: that is not so.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma rig pa dang yid @135b mi bde ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang yid @135b mi bde ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said that ignorance and mental dissatisfaction are the fetters.

original: 'dir sngon nas 'khor bar skye par byed pa ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngon nas 'khor bar skye par byed pa ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: Here, ignorance is that which causes birth in cyclic existence from the beginning.

original: des na sems can thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi nyes pa rnams kyis 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na sems can thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi nyes pa rnams kyis 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all sentient beings are bound by the faults of the latent tendencies of discursive thought.

original: rtogs pa rnams kyis ni de rnam par bcom pa'i phyir bcings pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa rnams kyis ni de rnam par bcom pa'i phyir bcings pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But those who have realized the truth are liberated from bondage because they have destroyed that.

original: 'on kyang sngon gyi las kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis ji srid du sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ba de srid du 'khor ba'i bcings pa las grol bar mi 'gyur te /

original: rang gi phung po la sogs pa'i sgrib pa rnams zad pa'i phyir grol bar brjod do //
analyzed: rang gi phung po la sogs pa'i sgrib pa rnams zad pa'i phyir grol bar brjod do //
translated: But they are said to be liberated because they have exhausted the obscurations of their own aggregates and so on.

original: de ltar phan tshun zo chu'i 'khrul 'khor bzhin sems can gyi rigs grangs med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs grangs med pa rnams nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phan tshun zo chu'i 'khrul 'khor bzhin sems can gyi rigs grangs med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs grangs med pa rnams nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
translated: In this way, the countless types of sentient beings and the countless types of Buddhas should be illustrated as mutually revolving like a waterwheel.

original: 'o na 'di ltar pha las bu skye bar 'gyur mod pa ni mkhas pa chen pa bya ba chos dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan la /
analyzed: 'o na 'di ltar pha las bu skye bar 'gyur mod pa ni mkhas pa chen pa bya ba chos dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan la /
translated: Now, although a son is born from a father, the father is endowed with good qualities such as being a great scholar, a righteous man, and so on.

analyzed: de'i bu ni las ngan pa la dga' ba rmongs pa chos mi byed pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas gos pa dang ldan no //
translated: His son is defiled by faults such as delighting in evil deeds, being deluded, not practicing the Dharma, and so on.

original: des na 'dir ma rig pa dang yid mi bde bas sems khyad par can rnams skyed par byed do //
analyzed: des na 'dir ma rig pa dang yid mi bde bas sems khyad par can rnams skyed par byed do //
translated: Therefore, here, the special minds are generated by ignorance and mental dissatisfaction.

original: phyi'i lus la brten pa de thams cad nyes pas gos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi'i lus la brten pa de thams cad nyes pas gos par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of that, based on the external body, becomes defiled by faults.

original: ji ltar me long gsal ba nyid la dngos po sna tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir de la gzugs brnyan snang bas gsal ba yang sngar gyi gzugs spangs nas bems por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar me long gsal ba nyid la dngos po sna tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir de la gzugs brnyan snang bas gsal ba yang sngar gyi gzugs spangs nas bems por 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as in a clear mirror, due to the display of various things, the reflection appears in it, the clarity abandons the previous form and becomes inanimate.

original: 'on kyang 'dir lus dang ngag dang sems gsal ba rnams mi gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir lus dang ngag dang sems gsal ba rnams mi gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But here, the clear body, speech, and mind become unclear.

original: des na skye bo la sogs pa rnams kyi dngos po sna tshogs pa mthong bas gsal ba'i sngon gyi gzugs spangs nas rmongs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na skye bo la sogs pa rnams kyi dngos po sna tshogs pa mthong bas gsal ba'i sngon gyi gzugs spangs nas rmongs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the various things of people, etc., are seen, and having abandoned the previous clear form, they become confused.

original: de rnams btul ba'i rgyus de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams btul ba'i rgyus de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes bzhin no //
translated: By the cause of subduing them, there is the vigilance of the Tathagata.

original: de rnams 'dul ba'i dus su yang de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'i phyir sems dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams 'dul ba'i dus su yang de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'i phyir sems dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And at the time of subduing them, the mind becomes mindful by seeing the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin du dus gsum rim pa bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus gsum rim pa bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the three times should be understood in sequence.

original: de la rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rim pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The sequence is as follows:

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The internal body is the cause that produces the Tathagata.

original: de yang sngon du gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang sngon du gsungs so //
translated: And that was taught previously.

original: de nas phyi'i lus rgyan gyi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de nas phyi'i lus rgyan gyi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Then, the external body is the ornament of the form of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i lus ni 'jig rten gyi bsam pa byang chub sems dpa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i lus ni 'jig rten gyi bsam pa byang chub sems dpa'i rigs so //
translated: Likewise, the inner and outer body is the family of the Bodhisattva, the thought of the world.

original: de yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed pa'i @136a * //
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed pa'i @136a * //
translated: And that is the nature of the result, because it performs the deeds of the Buddha.

original: phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: de ltar gzugs kyi phung po rnams par snang mdzad kyi rigs sku gsum du rnam par gzhag pa'am yang na chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'o zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs kyi phung po rnams par snang mdzad kyi rigs sku gsum du rnam par gzhag pa'am yang na chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'o zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the aggregate of form is Vairocana, established as the three bodies, or else as the Dharma Body, the Complete Enjoyment Body, and the Emanation Body. This is the determination.

original: da ni de bzhin du tshor ba rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du tshor ba rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in the same way, in order to teach the three kinds of feeling, he says:

original: nang gi tshor ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúInner feeling,‚Äù etc.

original: 'dir tshor ba'i phung po ni rin chen 'byung ldan te /
analyzed: 'dir tshor ba'i phung po ni rin chen 'byung ldan te /
translated: Here, the aggregate of feeling is Ratnasa·πÉbhava.

original: de'i lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid kyi tshor ba ni rnam ba gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid kyi tshor ba ni rnam ba gsum mo //
translated: Its feeling, which is of the nature of body, speech, and mind, is threefold.

original: 'dir rin chen 'byung ldan ni rdul gyi khams so //
analyzed: 'dir rin chen 'byung ldan ni rdul gyi khams so //
translated: Here, Ratnasa·πÉbhava is the element of dust.

original: de las byung ba ni tshor ba ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni tshor ba ste /
translated: That which arises from it is feeling.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag go //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag go //

original: de la gang tshor ba bde ba ni nang gi bdag nyid do /
analyzed: de la gang tshor ba bde ba ni nang gi bdag nyid do /
translated: Among them, that which is a pleasant feeling is the inner nature.

analyzed: des bde ba'i rnam pa'i bcom ldan 'das rang rig pa'i lus kyi bdag nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: By that, the nature of the body of the Blessed One, which is of the nature of self-awareness, is indicated.

analyzed: des gang tshor ba sdug bsngal ba de ni sems can la dmigs pa'i snying rje ste /

original: ngag gi brjod pas chos mang po ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag gi brjod pas chos mang po ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it teaches the many dharmas through verbal expression.

original: gang tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba de ni sems can gyi rigs can gyi ste /
analyzed: gang tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba de ni sems can gyi rigs can gyi ste /

analyzed: dngos po'i tshogs pas gzhan gyis sems khong du chud pa de'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is the understanding of others through the collection of entities.

original: des na yang tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhes pa ni sems can de rnams la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam rjes su ston pa'i tshor ba don mthun pa nyid kyi bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na yang tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhes pa ni sems can de rnams la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam rjes su ston pa'i tshor ba don mthun pa nyid kyi bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the statement one should look on with equanimity at feelings means that the feeling of having the same goal as those sentient beings is the means of attraction that teaches the path to complete perfect enlightenment.

original: shes bzhin dang rnam par spyod ces pa la dang gi spyod ni sems can de rnams kyis yang dag pa'i lam shes nas spyod pa ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin dang rnam par spyod ces pa la dang gi spyod ni sems can de rnams kyis yang dag pa'i lam shes nas spyod pa ste /
translated: The phrase with knowledge and conduct means that those sentient beings, having understood the true path, engage in conduct.

original: kun rdzob dang dam pa'i rnal 'byor gyis ji srid nam mkha'i mthar thug par sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang dam pa'i rnal 'byor gyis ji srid nam mkha'i mthar thug par sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: By means of the conventional and ultimate yogas, they benefit sentient beings as far as the end of space.

original: ma rig pa dang yid mi bde ba zhes pa ni de ltar tshor ba rnam pa gsum la brten pa'i sems so //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang yid mi bde ba zhes pa ni de ltar tshor ba rnam pa gsum la brten pa'i sems so //
translated: The phrase ignorance and mental dissatisfaction refers to the mind that is based on those three types of feelings.

analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis tshor ba'o //

original: de sad pa ni tshor ba bde ba'o //
analyzed: de sad pa ni tshor ba bde ba'o //
translated: When that is awakened, it is pleasant feeling.

original: dran pa dang ldan ba ni rig pa bzang po skyed par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan ba ni rig pa bzang po skyed par byed do zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: de ltar lus bzhi'i bdag nyid tshor ba ni tshor ba'i phung po'o //
translated: Thus, feeling, which has the nature of the four bodies, is the aggregate of feeling.

original: de'i yang dag par dran pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yang dag par dran pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second application of mindfulness is for the purpose of being mindful of that.

original: de bzhin du chos rjes su dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rjes su dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, in order to teach the application of mindfulness of phenomena,

original: nang gi chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nang gi chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe internal phenomena,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid chos rnams kyi tshig gi lam gyis nges par gsungs shing bcom @136b ldan 'das kyis chos bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid chos rnams kyi tshig gi lam gyis nges par gsungs shing bcom @136b ldan 'das kyis chos bstan to //
translated: Here, the Blessed One taught the Dharma with the words of the phenomena that are the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de yang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Moreover, they are the nature of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de dag ni lung gzhan rnams las rgyas par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni lung gzhan rnams las rgyas par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Those should be understood in detail from other scriptures.

original: bdag gis ni gzhung rgyas pas 'jigs bas ma brjod do //
analyzed: bdag gis ni gzhung rgyas pas 'jigs bas ma brjod do //
translated: I will not write about them out of fear of being verbose.

original: 'on kyang man ngag gis brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang man ngag gis brjod de /
translated: However, I will explain them by way of instruction.

original: nang gi chos rnams zhes pa ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis padma'i skud rtsa lta bu rnams la gang brten pa'i sems te /
analyzed: nang gi chos rnams zhes pa ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis padma'i skud rtsa lta bu rnams la gang brten pa'i sems te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe internal phenomena‚Äù are the mind that is based on the seventy-two thousand channels that are like lotus fibers.

original: de yang chos can zhes brjod de rang rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang chos can zhes brjod de rang rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is also called the ‚Äúphenomenon‚Äù because it is the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gyis yul dang yul can rnams la lta ba'i chos ni nang gi chos rnams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gyis yul dang yul can rnams la lta ba'i chos ni nang gi chos rnams so //
